titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Aleksandr Polovet͡s papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Yves Franquien

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-12-14T09:49-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: October 2017: Collection processed by Yves Franquien and entered into Archivists' Toolkit by Frances Heldt.

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, printed matter, and audiovisual material relating to Russian literature and to Russian émigré affairs.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p:
Collection is open for research.
The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual or digital material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Aleksandr Polovet͡s papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2017.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Moscow, Union of Soviet Socialist Republics
Received master's degree in Patent Information, Central Institute of Patent Studies
Vice President, later President, of Media Analysis Foundation
Founder and President of the Bulat Okudzhava USA Cultural Fund

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: This collection documents the professional life of Alexander Polovet͡s as a journalist, editor, and publisher of Panorama, one of the major Russian-language publications founded by Jewish immigrants from the Soviet Union.

Polovet͡s' correspondence is of special interest to literary scholars of the Third Wave, as it includes letters from authors such as Vasily Aksyonov, Yuz Aleshkovsky, Sergei Dovlatov, Anatoly Gladilin, Igor Guberman, Edward Limonov, and Vladimir Maximov. The collection is also of note since it includes photographs of authors and audio files of conversations with them. This also applies to other cultural and political figures.
An extensive file of photographs, and sound and video recordings chronicles Alexander Polovet͡s’ friendship with Bulat Okudzhava.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bio-bibliographical material, birthday greeting, identification papers, interviews, and press coverage, arranged by physical form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Untitled compilation containing his brief biography, family information, bibliography of his works, excerpts from reviews of his books, and information on his friendship with Bulat Okudzhava.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Congratulatory articles on the occasion of his 65th and 80th birthdays. See also: OVERSIZE FILE.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Recordings (transferred to CDs) of Alexander Polovet͡s’ conversations with writers, and cultural and political figures. In two parts, arranged alphabetically in each part by last name.

did.unittitle: Inventory of recordings in Part 1, providing biographical information on each interviwee, date of conversation, recording length, and brief content summaries of the conversations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Provides biographical information on each interviewee, date of conversation, recording length, and brief content summaries of the conversations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about his chess career, the political situation in Russia, his publishing ventures and plans for the future. 1 file. Duration: 49 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about literary matters, the role and fate of the older generation of Soviet writers, the reforms of Khrushchev and Gorbachev. 2 files. Duration: 2 hours.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about Soviet leaders with whom he worked, Perestroika, the work of his institute, Russian-American relations, his feelings about dissidents, and his forecast of future Russian policies. 2 files. Duration: 2 hours.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about different aspects of his biography, emigration, cultural relations, and contacts with his fellow-countrymen living abroad. 2 files. Duration: 138 minutes (58 min. + 50 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about his book “The Last Empire” devoted to the national and colonial policy of Soviet imperialism. 1 file. Duration: 38 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about his musical life, difficulties encountered during the Soviet period due to censorship and bureaucratic hurdles. 2 files. Duration: 31 minutes (21 min. + 10 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about his decision to leave the USSR, the difficulties he encountered, life in the USA, and comparison of the Russian and American theatrical systems. 2 files. Duration: 51 minutes (31 min. + 20 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about key moments and figures in Soviet history, conditions in pre-World War II Europe. 2 files. Duration: 2 hours, 45 minutes (1 hr. 2 min. + 33 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about the details of his decision to leave the USSR by any means possible, his experiences in Turkey and America, and plans for the future. 2 files. Duration: 55 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about the history of Panorama, current conditions in Russia, offers to collaborate with American publishers. 2 files. Duration: 1 hour, 21 minutes (1 hr. + 21 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about the murder of Sergei Mazhorov, a prominent Russian businessman. 1 file. Duration: 19 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about the fate of songs performed by their authors in Russia and their role as a guardian of the Russian language and culture in Germany, Israel, and the USA. 1 file. Duration: 37 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about literary prizes, his trial and exile, emigration to and life in Israel, and contemporary Russia. 3 files. Duration: 1 hour, 27 ninutes (43 min. + 3 min. + 41 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about current conditions in Russia and literary matters. 2 files. Duration: 59 minutes (43 min. + 16 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about different aspects of the political situation in Russia. 3 files. Duration: 2 hours, 4 minutes (51 min. + 45 min. + 28 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A conversation comparing the role and place of authors in the Soviet Union and the USA. 2 files. Duration: 1 hour, 25 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wide-ranging conversations about his personal and professional life in Russia and the USA, including his movies and American cinema. 4 files. Duration: 3 hours, 8 minutes (47 min. + 47 min. + 47 min. + 47 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A conversation about different aspects of her acting career, her acting studio, and impressions of various Russian cultural figures. 3 files. Duration: 2 hours (45 min. + 45 min. + 45 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about his passion for jazz, his jazz orchestra in Shanghai and in the USSR, and impressions of their tours abroad. 2 files. Duration: 1 hour, 50 minutes (52 min. + 48 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about what led to war in the Chechen Republic and the mistakes of the Yeltsin government. 3 files. Duration: 1 hour (7 min. + 44 min. + 9 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 3 files. Duration: 55 minutes of Nadein in conversation with Sergei Rakhlin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation with this famous journalist on a wide range of issues, including the economics of the post-Soviet newspaper business. 2 files. Duration: 50 minutes of Nadein in conversation with Alexander Polovets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about his work as a defense attorney and legal issues arising from the disparity between a new social order and outdated laws. 2 files. Duration: 51 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about various aspects of his biography, such as being accused of murder, convicted, and sent to prison. 3 files. Duration: 2 hours, 20 minutes (1 hr. and 10 min. + 40 min. + 30 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about the “hierarchy” of different sports in the USSR, the difficulty of being a sports star, and relations between sportsmen and their trainers. 2 files. Duration: 1 hour, 36 minutes (48 min. + 48 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversations dealing with various aspects of water and hydrology. 8 files. Duration: 3 hours, 30 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation dealing with the artist’s move from France to the USA, the return to traditional values, and the relationship between the new and the old in the artist’s work. 1 file. Duration: 30 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 2 files. Duration: 1 hour, 42 minutes (57 min. + 42 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Discussion of stand-up comedy and the difficulties of working with an audience with a different linguistic and cultural backround, and state of mind. 4 files. Duration: 55 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about his movie career, creative freedom, immigration to the USA, and feelings about post-Soviet Russia. 4 files. Duration: 1 hour, 20 minutes (40 min. + 40 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Provides biographical information on each interviewee, date of conversation, recording length, and brief content summaries of the conversations.

did.unittitle: Presentation at "Russian Literature in Exile" conference,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1 file. Duration: 28 minutes.

did.unittitle: Interview by A. Polovets and Alena Aksyonova,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 2 files. Duration: 42 minutes (30 min. + 12 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1 file. Duration: 1 hour.

did.unittitle: Answers to questions posed by Panorama editorial staff,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 2 files. Duration: 63 minutes (31 min. + 32 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about the difficulties of making it in Hollywood, the differences between movie making in the Soviet Union and the USA, and his plans for the future. 2 files. Duration: 1 hour.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about the August coup attempt against Gorbachev, general issues of USSR-USA relations, American assistance, and the Moscow PEN-Center. 1 file. Duration: 21 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about his escape from the USSR and obtainment of asylum. 2 files. Duration: 40 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about the role of literature under current conditions, the historical fiction of Valentin Pikul, working with graduate students, and increasing the role of books in the lives of Soviet people. 2 files. Duration: 1 hour, 20 minutes (43 min. + 37 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation recalling their first meeting, the post-Stalin “Thaw”, some of the successes of Soviet literature despite oppression, and other literary matters. 1 file. Duration: 1 hour and 5 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation on the importance of increasing coverage of sexual topics in the Russian-language press, both quantitatively and qualitatively. 1 file. Duration: 30 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about Voice of America broadcasts to the Soviet Union, measures to combat Soviet jamming, and the importance of feedback from Soviet listeners. 1 file. Duration: 17 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about the work of the Russian American Medical Association. 1 file. Duration: 45 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Telephone conversation about the “shestidesiatniki” (1960s generation)and their unique role in Soviet literature, emigration past and present, and Gladilin’s feelings about Los Angeles and Panorama. 1 file. Duration: 47 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation on current political affairs, with an emphasis on the condition of Jews in the USSR and the problems of their emigration. 1 file. Duration: 23 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation on the professionalization of sports in Russia. 1 file. Duration: 20 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation on a wide range of topics, including contemporary politics and his career as a psychotherapist, hypnotist and psychic healer. 4 files. Duration: 1 hour, 43 minutes (35 min. + 30 min. + 30 min. + 8 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation on literary matters, visits to the USA by Soviet writers, and the low level of social engagement among emigrants from the USSR. 2 files. Duration: 40 minutes (35 min. + 5 min.).

did.unittitle: Kruglyi stol chitatelei v gazete “Panorama” (Round table with Panorama readers),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Discussion of issues related to the publication, content, and distribution of the newspaper. 2 files. Duration: 1 hour, 30 minutes (45 min. + 45 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation on the key moments in the military career of this Marshal of the Soviet Union and his thoughts on military strategy and politics in general. 1 file. Duration: 1 hour, 5 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation regarding this author’s novel “Eto ia, Edichka!” (It’s Me, Eddie), contemporary Russian literature, his reading habits, and other issues. 2 files. Duration: 65 minutes (32 min. + 33 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Presentations by writers Rafail Nudelman, Viktor Nekrasov, and Nikolai Bokov. 1 file. Duration: 30 minutes (10 min. + 10 min. +10 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation on the failure of Russian liberals, Russo-American relations, and current Russian political problems. 2 files. Duration: 1 hour, 30 minutes (45 min. + 45 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation on various aspects of Russian-American relations, military doctrine and use of nuclear weapons, the Chechen conflict and territorial integrity of Russia. 1 file. Duration: 30 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about the fate of professional musicians in the USSR, his family, and ancestors. 1 file. Duration: 11 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation regarding his literary career, his interest in the history of Odessa Jewry, and the diffences between the editing process in the USSR and the USA. 1 file. Duration: 25 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation with the director and his wife Vera Alentova about the current state of the Russian cinema, the transition to a market economy, and their impressions of their trip to the USA. 1 file. Duration: 41 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation on the 95th anniversary of the birth of her father, theater director Solomon Mikhoels, centered on his biography and the need to preserve is heritage. 1 file. Duration: 33 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about the state of journalism in contemporary Russia, professional ethics, and the role of new entrepreneurs. 1 file. Duration: 30 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about the mentalist’s use of her paranormal abilities to diagnose and treat illness. 3 files. Duration: 1 hour (30 min. + 20 min. + 10 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Appearance on Moscow radio about the illness and operation of Bulat Okudzhava to dispel all the rumors regarding them. 1 file. Duration: 7 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about Russian-language singer-songwriters in Los Angeles, the influence of Bulat Okudzhava and Vladimir Vysotsky, and generational differences regarding songs. 1 file. Duration: 17 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about his work with director Sergei Bondarchuk, his escape to the USA through Mexico, and the start of his new life in Los Angeles. 2 files. Duration: 45 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation with Vladimir Rachikhin’s ex-wife about their marriage and its collapse. 2 files. Duration: 1 hour, 10 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about his encounters with Lithuanian politician Vytautas Landsbergis, members of the Lithuanian intelligentsia, the lives of different ethnic groups, and the issue of emigration. 2 files. Duration: 1 hour, 10 minutes (46 min. + 24 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversations on a broad variety of issues related to the arts, politics and social conditions in Russia. 5 files. Duration: 2 hours (50 min. + 6 min. + 32 min. + 32 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation with the son of Andrei Sakharov’s wife from her former marriage about his emigration, the Sakharovs, and the potential for American influence to improve their conditions of exile in the city of Gorky. 1 file. Duration: 30 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation touching upon the magazine “Sovershenno sekretno”, the detective genre, aspects of the writer’s biography, and current conditions in the Soviet Union. 2 files. Duration 55 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about Sevela’s books, his life, his meetings with readers, and politics. 2 files. Duration: 1 hour, 55 minutes (25 min. + 45 min. + 45 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation (in English) on a wide variety of topics related to the condition of Jews in the world and in Russia, and the possibility of improved Russo-Israeli relations. 2 files. Duration: 1 hour (30 min. + 30 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about the Swiss national character, humorists, the theme of Jewishness in his work, his difficulties in working in the USSR, and the main areas of focus of his joint literary work with his brother. 2 files. Duration: 1 hour, 20 minutes (65 min. + 15 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation regarding the situation in Europe, especially in Bosnia and Kosovo, and his take on the Russian economy. 1 file. Duration: 43 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about this writer’s creative process, how he became a writer, his emigration, and his need for inner freedom. 2 files. Duration: 1 hour, 3 minutes (32 min. + 31 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about his work at “Iunost’” magazine and “Literaturnaia gazeta” with the best Soviet satirists and what motivated him to emigrate. 1 file. Duration: 1 hour, 5 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation about his emigration to the USA, his search for his Soviet-made movies at the Pacific Film Archive, and his work as a motion picture director in America. 2 files. Duration: 1 hour (30 min. + 30 min.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conversation with several activists of the Russian-language Jewish community in Los Angeles about building a new Chabad synagogue and its future social, spiritual and cultural significance. 1 file. Duration: 42 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A reading by the author of some of his erotic poetry and a conversation about his work and the possibility of publishing a small volume of his verse. 1 file. Duration: 30 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A recording of his presentation at the Literature in Exile conference in Los Angeles. 1 file. Duration: Not indicated.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs and audiovisual materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lists publications devoted to Bulat Okudzhava in the Russian-language press in the United States from 1989 to 1999 held in the personal archive of V. Yurovsky.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Packets of photographs mainly chronicling Okudzhava’s 1991 trip to the United States.

did.unittitle: Inventory prepared by Alexander Polovet͡s providing detailed information on each photograph
Bulat Okudzhava's first visit to Los Angeles,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 3 color prints depicting Okudzhava with Alexander Polovets, Yakov Skliansky, Ilya Baskin, and Victor Shulman.

did.unittitle: Bulat Okudzhava's Hollywood High School concert,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Selected prints of the prints in the preceding folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Negatives to the prints in the preceding folders as well as some unprinted negatives of memorial concerts and events for Bulat Okudzhava in Los Angeles and Peredelkino, Russia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a KABC Los Angeles radio host requesting support for payment of Okudzhava’s hospital bills.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a collection of Okudzhava's music.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a 90-minute interview conducted by Aoexander Polovets with Naum Korzhavin regarding Bulat Okudzhava.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a message on Alexander Povets’ answering machine regarding Okudzhava, as well as a recording of a phone call from Okudzhava to Alexander Polovets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a Voice of America “Washington Encounter” program in which Okudzhava is interviewed with a group of artists. Recorded after Okudzhava’s operation, he discusses his visits to the United States in 1979, 1987, 1990 and 1991.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a discussion with Dr. Busi in Okudzhava’s presence after his operation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains an Ekho Mosky interview with Alexander Polovets regarding Okudzhava.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains an interview with Okudzhava by Alexander Polovets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a concert given by Okudzhava at the home of Alexander Polovets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains the opening of the memorial statue for Okudzhava on the Arbat in Moscow.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains an interview with Okudzhava as well as a memorial concert featuring other artists performing Okudzhava material.

did.unittitle: DVDs "A night for Bulat" in 2 parts (5W),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains an outdoor concert at Rehelgaus Theater in Moscow with a series of artists performing Okudzhava material.

scopecontent.p: Disc has no sound.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains selected poetry readings in Moscow, with Okudzhava reading first.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a performance by Elena Kamburova.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains many songs and an extensive question and answer session.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains Okudzhava being interviewed by Miroslava Sverdlova and a young Okudzhava reading his poetry and playing a guitar on a television show.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains Okudzhava’s performance at Alexander Polovets’ home, scenes of Okudzhava at Venice Beach watching and listening to African-American street singers, touring Rodeo Drive and Chinatown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains excerpts from Okudzhava’s films and interviews.

scopecontent.p: Contains performances by Moscow and Leningrad bards at the Polytechnic Museum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains commercials for Panorama newspaper on American television featuring Mikhail Kazakov, Bulat Okudzhava, and Arkady Arkanov, as well as a “Behind the Scenes” Panorama commercial with Okudzhava and Anatoly Gladilin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a documentary film for television.
